page.title: 06SYDMONTON & THE MEDIA
page.content: THE AREA IS FAMOUS FOR "WATERSHIP DOWN". THIS IS THE TITLE OF A BEST-SELLING BOOK WRITTEN IN 1972 BY RICHARD ADAMS. A FILM WAS LATER MADE. THE BOOK TELLS THE ADVENTURES OF A COLONY OF RABBITS WHICH SET UP A WARREN ON THE DOWN. THE BOOK MENTIONS ACTUAL PLACES LIKE NUTHANGER FARM, & TOPOGRAPHICAL FEATURES LIKE A GROUP OF HUGE BEECH TREES ON THE EDGE OF LADLE HILL. THE DOWN RECEIVES VISITORS BECAUSE IT IS THE SETTING OF THE BOOK AND SOME HAVE EVEN CARVED THE NAMES OF CHARACTERS FROM THE BOOK ON TREE TRUNKS GROWING THERE.
